KPK Panggil 2 Orang Saksi Suap Kuota Impor Ikan di Perum Perindo
07 Nov 2019, 11:44 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Panggil 2 Orang Saksi Suap Kuota Impor Ikan di Perum Perindo

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) hari ini dijadwalkan memanggil sejumlah saksi dalam kasus perkara dugaan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) suap kuota impor ikan di Perum Perikanan Indonesia (Perindo).
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta mengatakan, sedikitnya ada 2 pejabat dari Kementerian Kelautan dan Perikanan (KKP) dan Kementerian Perdagangan (Kemendag) yang dipanggil KPK.
Febri menjelaskan bahwa mereka dipanggil untuk dimintai keterangannya sebagai saksi terkait kasus perkara dugaan suap kuota impor ikan di Perum Perindo.
"Yang bersangkutan dipanggil dalam kapasitasnya  sebagai saksi untuk tersangka MMU (Mujib Mustofa)," kata Febri Diansyah di Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Febri menjelaskan bahwa kedua saksi yang dipanggil itu masing-masing Prayudi Budi Utomo Pelaksana Tugas (Plt) Direktur Logistik PDSKP Kementerian Kelautan dan Perikanan (Kementrian KKP) dan Karsan, Kepala Sub Direktorat (Kasubdit)  Barang Konsumsi Direktorat Impor Ditjen Perdagangan Luar Negeri Kementrian Perdagangan (Kemendag). 
Penyidik KPK sebelumnya telah menetapkan menetapkan Mujib Mustofa dan  mantan Direktur Utama (Dirut) Perum Perindo Risyanto Suanda sebagai tersangka.
KPK menduga bahwa tersangka Mujib yang saat itu masih menjabat sebagai Direktur PT Navy Arsa Sejahtera (NAS) memberikan uang suap dengan tujuan agar mendapatkan kuota impor ikan dari Perum Perindo.
KPK menduga tersangka Risyanto Suanda menerima uang suap sebesar 30 ribu Dolar Amerika (USD) dari tersangka Mujib. 
Wakil Ketua KPK Saut Situmorang sebelumnya menjelaskan kepada wartawan bahwa Setelah 250 ton ikan berhasil diimpor oleh PT NAS, kemudian ikan-ikan tersebut berada di karantina dan disimpan di “cold storage” atau lemari pendingin milik Perum Perindo. 
Berdasarkan keterangan tersangka  MMU (Mujib), hal ini dilakukan dengan tujuan untuk mengelabui otoritas yang berwenang agar seolah-olah yang melakukan impor ikan tersebut adalah Perum Perindo.

KPK Calls 2 Witnesses to Bribe Fish Import Quota at Perindo Perindo
Nov 7 2019, 11:44 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Calls 2 Witnesses to Bribe Fish Import Quota at Perindo Perindo

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) today are scheduled to summon witnesses in a case of alleged Corruption (Tipikor) bribery for fish import quotas at the Indonesian Fisheries Corporation (Perindo).
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta that at least 2 officials from the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (KKP) and the Ministry of Trade (Ministry of Trade) were called the KPK.
Febri explained that they were called in to be questioned as witnesses related to cases of alleged bribery of fish import quotas at Perindo Perindo.
"The person concerned was summoned in his capacity as a witness for the suspect MMU (Mujib Mustofa)," said Febri Diansyah in Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Febri explained that the two witnesses summoned were Prayudi Budi Utomo Acting Director (PDTKP) Logistics Director of the Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries (Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries) and Karsan, Head of Sub Directorate (Kasubdit) Consumer Goods Import Directorate General of Foreign Trade Ministry of Trade (Ministry of Trade and Fisheries) Ministry of Trade).
KPK investigators had previously set Mujib Mustofa and former Managing Director (Perut) of Perindo Perindo Risyanto Suanda as suspects.
The KPK suspects that the suspect Mujib, who was then still serving as Director of PT Navy Arsa Sejahtera (NAS), gave bribes with the aim of obtaining a fish import quota from Perum Perindo.
The KPK suspects the suspect Risyanto Suanda received a bribe of 30 thousand US Dollars (USD) from the suspect Mujib.
KPK Deputy Chairman Saut Situmorang previously explained to reporters that after 250 tons of fish were successfully imported by PT NAS, then the fish were in quarantine and stored in "cold storage" or Perum Perindo's refrigerators.
Based on the information of the suspect MMU (Mujib), this was done with the aim of tricking the competent authority so that it was as if the one who imported the fish was Perum Perindo.
